title: Charles Kinkead
text:
Charles Kinkead <a href="Order%20of%20Distinction">OD</a> (3 October 1913 – 1 June 2007) was a <a href="Jamaica">Jamaica</a>n <a href="photojournalist">photojournalist</a> and <a href="journalist">journalist</a>, whose career spanned more than four decades.
Born Charles Harold Austin Kinkead, he worked as a <a href="news">news</a> <a href="photographer">photographer</a> for a number of Jamaican <a href="publication">publication</a>s during his career. Among the <a href="newspaper">newspaper</a>s who he worked for were "<a href="Gleaner%20Company">The Gleaner</a>", the "<a href="Jamaica%20Standard">Jamaica Standard</a>", the "<a href="Daily%20News%20%28Jamaica%29">Daily News</a>", and the "<a href="Jamaica%20Times">Jamaica Times</a>", a weekly newspaper publication.
While working at the "Daily News", Kinkead won the <a href="Seprod%20Human%20Interest%20Photograph%20Award">Seprod Human Interest Photograph Award</a> in 1973. In 1978, Kinkead also won a national Jamaican award, the <a href="Order%20of%20Distinction">Order of Distinction</a>, "for his contribution in the field of photo-journalism".
Kinkead moved to <a href="Florida">Florida</a> in the 1980s to retire. He died of a <a href="stroke">stroke</a> on 1 June 2007, aged 93, at a Florida hospital after becoming ill at his home in <a href="Pembroke%20Pines%2C%20Florida">Pembroke Pines</a>. He was survived by his wife and five children. A service of thanksgiving for his life was held on 14 June 2007 at the St James Cathedral in <a href="Spanish%20Town">Spanish Town</a>, Jamaica.
